physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features four individuals, standing over a table. Two men are dressed in a suit, the man on the right dressed in a shirt, and the woman dressed in a dress. On the table, there is an opened frame box. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of group standing over table
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008
